comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Bitcointalk has the most that any Bitcoin or cryptocurrency forum could offer. So in terms of resources, Bitcointalk is simply incomparable. Not only is this forum created by Satoshi himself/herself/themselves, this forum is also where many of the earliest discussions of Bitcoin happened. History happened here. HODL originated here. Laszlo made his infamous 10,000-BTC offer here. Brilliant minds in Bitcoin and altcoin had discussed ideas here. The likes of Hal Finney, Adam Back, Andreas Antonopoulos, Jameson Lopp, Greg Maxwell, Ross Ulbricht, Vitalik Buterin, Charlie Lee, Charles Hoskinson, and many others were all here.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: I can't speak for other people why they choose this particular forum, but I can say what exactly I like here:1. Lively and active community.There will always be people who report on changes in the crypto world and beyond. Forum participants will immediately join the discussion of these topics, which allows you to get different points of view on the same situations. The more opinions we take into account, the more objectively we can get an idea of what happened.2. Knowledge base.Discussion of technical (and not only) questions allows readers to use this forum as a place where you can find a lot of answers. Information is constantly being accumulated and added to, which makes this information base in a sense evolving. 3. Historical component.All the same, Bitcoin and Crypto Era began with this forum and bitcointalk is of great importance in the development of thecrypto community and bitcoin. A lot of important events happened or began here and it's nice to realize belonging to this community, albeit on a modest scale.Â 4. Events and competitions.If the community is active, then various contests will not be rare, as you can see for yourself. Starting from the art conquesst and ending with the culinary contest, like pizza-day contest. There is a wide variety of them.5. Signature and bounty campaigns. It would be hypocritical not to mention it. It can be considered a nice bonus to be able to participate in this campaigns.In one form or another, some of the items on this list are in other forums, but I think they are far behind the bitcointalk. And if compared with the forums indicated by OP, then for the most part they turned out to be "half-dead" (almost inactive), in my opinion, when I looked at them.
